message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses recent advances in neuroscience and their potential to advance our understanding of artificial neural networks. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. The paper also investigates the ability to model high dimensional recognition problems using single or several neurons networks, which falls under the scope of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of datasets and testing for multi-class recognition tasks suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the potential application of these findings to optimize artificial neural networks suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.SY (Systems and Control).
